Directions: Base your answer to the following questions on the passage and data table below and on your knowledge of science.
Title: Electromagnet Strength
Content: A group of students were experimenting with building electromagnets in science class. To do this, the students wrapped a piece of insulated copper wire around an iron nail and then connected the two ends of the wire to a battery, making the nail magnetic. The number of wraps of the wire around the nail affected the number of metal paperclips that the electromagnet could pick up at one time.
